name: Apples (Seedless)
serving_suggestions: Remove ALL seeds and core (contain cyanide). Slice thin. Fresh only.
calories_per_serving: Small: ~3-5 cal, Medium: 8-10 cal, Large: 15-16 cal
description: Apples provide fiber, vitamins A and C, and help clean teeth. Low in fat and calories makes them good for weight management. Crunchy texture helps freshen breath. CRITICAL: Must remove all seeds and core - apple seeds contain cyanide. Only fresh apple flesh is safe. Per USDA data: 52 calories per 100g, good source of dietary fiber.

name: Blueberries
serving_suggestions: Fresh or frozen. Perfect training treat size.
calories_per_serving: Small: ~3 cal, Medium: 6-8 cal, Large: 11-14 cal
description: Blueberries are superfood packed with antioxidants that support immune system and reduce inflammation. High fiber, vitamins C and K. Extremely low calorie makes them perfect training treats. Fresh or frozen both safe. Per USDA: 57 calories per 100g, 2-3 blueberries = approx 2 calories for cats.

name: Carrots (Raw or Cooked)
serving_suggestions: Raw (crunchy) or cooked (softer). Cut into bite-size pieces to prevent choking.
calories_per_serving: 1 large raw carrot (72g) = 30 cal, 1 baby carrot = ~4 cal
description: Carrots excellent source of beta-carotene which converts to vitamin A for eye health. High fiber aids digestion. Low calorie (41 cal/100g) perfect for weight management. Crunchy texture helps clean teeth. Can be raw or cooked. Safe for dogs and cats.

name: Green Beans (Fresh/Frozen/Canned No-Salt)
serving_suggestions: Fresh, frozen (no sauce), or canned (no salt added). Can be raw, steamed, or boiled.
calories_per_serving: Cooked 135g serving = 38 cal. Very low calorie!
description: Green beans are low-calorie, high-fiber vegetable perfect for weight management. Contains protein, vitamins C and K. Only 31 calories per 100g. Can replace up to 10% of dog's food for weight loss. Fresh, frozen (plain), or canned (no salt) all safe. Many dogs love them as crunchy treat.

name: Bananas
serving_suggestions: Small slices, mashed, or frozen. Remove peel.
calories_per_serving: 1 cup sliced (150g) = 134 cal. Higher cal so moderate!
caution: Higher in sugar/calories than other fruits - give in moderation
description: Bananas provide potassium, B6, vitamin C, and fiber. Natural sweetness makes them appealing. Good pre-exercise energy. However, higher in sugar and calories (89 cal/100g) so give in moderation. Can freeze for summer treat. Remove peel. Occasional treat only due to sugar content.
